data.title: Edit-Before-Save Workflow
data.content: Allows users to edit extracted insights before saving them to the knowledge base. This is achieved by using a slash command to display the insight, allowing the user to provide edits, and then calling `add_insight()` with the edited version. The original insight is skipped during the `approve_insights()` call by tracking edited indices in the session cache.

data.title: Manual Extraction Mode
data.content: Provides a `--manual` flag for the `/extract` command, allowing AI agents to directly read and analyze files, creating insights using the `add_insight()` tool. This bypasses the standard MCP extraction process and session cache, offering fine-grained control, offline functionality, and AI-driven reasoning.

data.title: Selective Saving of Insights
data.content: The `approve_insights` tool allows users to selectively save insights from a preview session based on their index. It reads insights from a session cache, saves the approved insights to the database and Git repository, and then clears the session cache.

data.title: Session Cache for Preview Mode
data.content: Insights extracted in preview mode are stored in a temporary session cache with a 30-minute expiry. This allows users to review and selectively approve insights before saving them permanently. The cache also tracks which insights have been edited.

data.title: Git Integration for Version Control
data.content: The system integrates with Git to track changes to the knowledge base. Commits are made after `approve_insights()`, `add_insight()`, and `archive_file()` operations, ensuring that all changes are version-controlled.

data.title: Foolproof Workflow: Extract → Review → Selective Save
data.content: This pattern describes the standard workflow for extracting insights. The user initiates the extraction, the agent displays the extracted insights, and the user selects which insights to save. The agent then calls `approve_insights()` to save the selected insights.

data.title: Foolproof Workflow: Extract → Edit → Save
data.content: This pattern extends the standard extraction workflow by allowing users to edit insights before saving them. The user selects an insight to edit, provides the edits, and the agent calls `add_insight()` with the edited version. The edited insight is saved as a new entry, and the original insight is skipped during the `approve_insights()` call.

data.title: Manual Insight Addition Pattern
data.content: Describes the pattern for manually adding insights. The user provides the insight details, and the agent calls `add_insight()` to save the insight to the knowledge base.

data.title: Error Handling: Session Not Found
data.content: Defines the error response for when a session ID is not found or has expired. The response includes an error code, a message, and a suggestion to run the `/extract` command again.

data.title: Error Handling: Invalid Indices
data.content: Defines the error response for when the provided indices are out of range for the session. The response includes an error code, a message indicating the valid range, and the provided invalid range.

data.title: Error Handling: Git Conflict
data.content: Defines the error response for when a Git conflict occurs. The response includes an error code, a message indicating that a Git pull is required, and an action to resolve the conflict.

data.title: Commit Message Structure After `approve_insights()`
data.content:
The commit message after `approve_insights()` includes a summary of the changes, the topics and categories of the insights, and the source file from which the insights were extracted.  Example: `Add 5 insights from AnimationRefactor.md

Topics: animation, performance
Categories: pattern, best_practice
Source: socialaize/AnimationRefactor.md`

data.title: Commit Message Structure After `add_insight()`
data.content:
The commit message after `add_insight()` includes a summary of the added insight, the topic and category of the insight, and an indication that it was a manual entry. Example: `Add insight: GPU-Accelerated Animation Properties

Topic: animation
Category: best_practice
Manual entry`

data.title: Commit Message Structure After `archive_file()`
data.content: The commit message after `archive_file()` includes a summary of the archived file and the number of insights extracted (if any). Example: `Archive: AnimationRefactor.md (11 insights extracted)`
